title: Australian killed surfing in Indonesia
text:
WHEN their flight approached the airport gate, a woman seated at the window tried to climb over another passenger. It did not go down well. Travel Updates Indonesia: Australian Ronald Schneider, 54, killed while surfing in south Sipura by: Australian surfer Ronald Stephen Schneider / Picture: Facebook Source: Facebook 
AN Australian surfer died after he was slammed into rocks in Indonesia. 
Ronald Stephen Schneider, 54, from Sawtell south of Coffs Harbour, was catching waves in south Sipura, part of the Mentawai Islands off Western Sumatra. 
Mentawai Resort Police head AKBP Reko Indro Sasongko confirmed the death of the longboard rider to The Jakarta Post. 
“He died on site while surfing after a wave slammed him into the rocks,” he said. 
Mentawai Surf Travel owner Delvinus Sabolak said he was on a surfing holiday at the time. 
“Yes Ronald Schneider a passenger on a surf charter boat for a Mentawai surf trip has passed away by surf accident,” Mr Sabolak said. 
“His leg was dragged by his leg rope then he was hit by the reef. The waves are pumping.” 
Aloita Resort & Spa owner Alessandro, who did not give his surname, said Mr Schneider was rushed to hospital but could not be revived. 
“He was taken to the hospital in Padang in Sumatra but I think he died before on the island,” he said. 
Mr Schneider’s body was being kept in Dr. M. Djamil General Hospital and was being prepared to be sent to Australia. He was a true water brother, Mr Schneider’s family says / Picture: Facebook Source: Facebook 
Sawtell Boardriders president Mark Hodgson posted a tribute to Mr Schneider who was a painter by trade. 
“We will all miss you Ron. A great bloke who would do anything to help the club out,” he said. 
“Our thoughts are with his family in this difficult time. God bless Ron.” 
His sister Tanya Schneider-Greenwood also posted a tribute saying, “my beautiful big brother Ron. God I am going to miss you, gone way too soon.” 
His brother in law Michael Greenwood also passed on his condolences: “You went out in the best way possible. Surfing in a beautiful tropical location, you always had a way about you.” 
Friend Kevin Joseph Cramer described his “sparkling blue eyes, a ready laugh, (and) always a kind word ... He was a true water brother.” 
Sawtell Boardriders have planned drinks to celebrate his life this afternoon. 
Martin Kelazic, the Australian owner of Hollow Tree’s Surf Resort on Sipura’s sparsely populated south coast, said 70 per cent of visitors were from Australia. 
“It’s the capital of Mentawai Islands but there are not yet sealed roads across the island,” he said. 
“The connection between where we live and the middle of the island is close to zero. There is no electricity, there is nothing. We generate it all on our own. 
“At the south of the island where we are we get 80 to a 100 people at a time. Probably have about 70 per cent of people would be Aussies.” 
Hundreds of surf lovers from across the world are dotted throughout the Mentawai Islands enjoying big-wave season. 
The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade confirmed Mr Schneider’s death in a statement. 
“The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade is providing consular assistance to the family of an Australian man who died in Indonesia, in line with the Consular Services Charter,” the statement said.
